alert.note: Alert for Niagara; Northern Erie (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 9:21PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Erie and southern Niagara Counties through 1015 PM EDT... At 919 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southwest of Niagara Falls, moving east at 40 mph. Additional isolated thunderstorms were also developing over western Niagara County. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, Niagara Falls, West Seneca, North Tonawanda, Clarence, Lockport, Kenmore, Depew, Tonawanda, Amherst, Lancaster, Williamsville, Grand Island, Elma, Pendleton, Erie Basin Marina, Lewiston, Small Boat Harbor and Sanborn. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 53 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
